cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwave.  This year has seen 6 heatwaves; typically, 1.9 heatwaves happen every year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The 2nd ranked rain rate was recorded today with a peak rate of 16.6mm per hour, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  5.69mm of rain fell during the storm's 3.2 hours length.  27.0mm per hour was the maximum rain rate recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

storm.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.
An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm we experienced was on 03 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The ongoing rainy stretch, 10 days and counting started on 26 August 2025 and ranks 4th in length since records started in August 2024.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (189°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.41 miles and so far today the wind run is 66.5 miles.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 5.0°C) and outside temperature (down 3.2°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.8 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 7 mbar), light levels (up 7961 lux), cloud levels (up 135 m), and rainfall (up 0.8 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 11360 lux), cloud levels (up 1604 m), and rainfall (down 0.4 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 134.6m lower than yesterday, 491.1m lower than the past week, 1604.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 565m and a high of 1838m, averaging 975.9m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, pleasant humidity levels and very little to no wind will be present. Rain showers likely, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and bright intervals likely. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
